Interface ReviewFlagRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<ReviewFlag, Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<ReviewFlag, Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<ReviewFlag, Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<ReviewFlag, Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<ReviewFlag, Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<ReviewFlag>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<ReviewFlag, Long>
@Repository public interface ReviewFlagRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<ReviewFlag, Long>
Repository interface for performing CRUD and custom query operations on ReviewFlag entities.

This repository manages review flag records created by users to report inappropriate or misleading reviews. It supports admin moderation workflows, flag tracking, and duplicate prevention for user-submitted flags.

Spring Data JPA automatically implements the standard CRUD operations, while the defined query methods below provide domain-specific filtering and retrieval capabilities.

Since:
2025-11-07
Version:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • findByStatusOrderByCreatedAtDesc

      List<ReviewFlag> findByStatusOrderByCreatedAtDesc(String status)
      Retrieves all review flags that match the specified status, ordered by their creation date in descending order.

      Commonly used for the admin moderation dashboard to show “PENDING” flags awaiting review.

      Parameters:
      status - the moderation status (e.g., "PENDING", "REVIEWED")
      Returns:
      a list of ReviewFlag entities sorted by most recent first

    • findByStatusAndReasonOrderByCreatedAtDesc

      List<ReviewFlag> findByStatusAndReasonOrderByCreatedAtDesc(String status, String reason)
      Retrieves all review flags that match both a specific status and reason, ordered by creation date in descending order.

      Useful for targeted filtering when moderators want to address reports of a certain type (e.g., “offensive content”).

      Parameters:
      status - the current status of the flag (e.g., "PENDING")
      reason - the reason string to filter by (e.g., "spam")
      Returns:
      a list of ReviewFlag entities matching the given criteria

    • findByStatusAndReasonContainingIgnoreCaseOrderByCreatedAtDesc

      List<ReviewFlag> findByStatusAndReasonContainingIgnoreCaseOrderByCreatedAtDesc(String status, String reasonPart)
      Retrieves all review flags whose reason field contains the specified substring (case-insensitive), filtered by status and sorted by creation date.

      Supports fuzzy searching of reasons (e.g., “false info”, “mislead”).

      Parameters:
      status - the flag status (e.g., "PENDING")
      reasonPart - a substring to match within the reason field
      Returns:
      a list of matching ReviewFlag entities

    • findByReviewId

      @Query("SELECT rf FROM ReviewFlag rf WHERE rf.review.id = :reviewId") List<ReviewFlag> findByReviewId(@Param("reviewId") Long reviewId)
      Retrieves all review flags associated with a specific review ID.

      Used when displaying all user reports related to a single review.

      Parameters:
      reviewId - the ID of the review being queried
      Returns:
      a list of ReviewFlag entities linked to the given review

    • existsByReviewIdAndUserId

      @Query("SELECT COUNT(rf) > 0 FROM ReviewFlag rf WHERE rf.review.id = :reviewId AND rf.user.id = :userId") boolean existsByReviewIdAndUserId(@Param("reviewId") Long reviewId, @Param("userId") Long userId)
      Checks if a specific user has already flagged a particular review.

      This prevents duplicate flag submissions from the same user and enforces single-flag-per-review behavior.

      Parameters:
      reviewId - the ID of the review being flagged
      userId - the ID of the user attempting to flag it
      Returns:
      true if the user has already flagged the review, false otherwise

    • findByReviewAndUser

      Optional<ReviewFlag> findByReviewAndUser(Review review, Users user)
      Retrieves a flag record for a specific user-review pair, if it exists.

      Used when checking whether a user has already flagged a review or for allowing updates to a previous report.

      Parameters:
      review - the Review being flagged
      user - the Users who submitted the flag
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the existing ReviewFlag, if any
